alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne, northeastern Kimball and southeastern Banner Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 225 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Dix, or 13 miles northeast of Kimball, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dix. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 31 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
